metadata.title: CVE-2017-14519 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In Poppler 0.59.0, memory corruption occurs in a call toObject::streamGetChar in Object.h after a repeating series of Gfx::display,Gfx::go, Gfx::execOp, Gfx::opShowText, and Gfx::doShowText calls (aka aGfx.cc infinite loop).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14519` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.6
libpoppler-cpp0 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.6
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.6
libpoppler-qt4-4 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.6
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.6
libpoppler44 - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.6
poppler-utils - 0.24.5-2ubuntu4.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: poppler package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.24.5-2ubuntu4.6').
